channel.title: Bmw x5 sav
channel.description:
Well, I don't know about you, but I like SUV's the most. They're safe in the case of a car accident, they're big and spacious, and more benefits to them. But what do you guys think about this SUV that BMW designed? I think it looks great.
[img]http://www.redbookasiapacific.com/nz/photos/BMW/BMW%200097.jpg[/img] [img]http://southbmw.com/images/x5gallery/images/bmw-x5-30.jpg[/img]

item.title: Bmw x5 sav
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Maedie1:

There’s just something about it. I can’t explain it…

The name.

Read full topic

item.title: Bmw x5 sav
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:30, topic:279138”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=368419.msg2792833#msg2792833 date=1242887798]

I never even notice the amount of noise coming from any of my vehicles.

thats because you’re used to that high ambient sound level, its like certain trades that work with tools like saws,drill, airbrushes and so on that create a really high pitched noise eventually their ears just block it out and you dont actually hear it.
[/quote]

I know that. But when my car is idle, it isn’t loud at all. I can hear it, but it’s a low rumble. It’s only when I punch the gas all the way to the floorboard do you hear the pistons slamming, and even then it’s not loud from in the cab. I like the sound to be honest.

When I hear the muffler on some chintzy import tuner whine, I get pissed off because it sounds awful. But when I hear a 69 Chevy Camaro SS roar down the highway I get goosebumps.[/quote]
i must admit i do love the sound of a good muscle car as much as i do that of a low slung sports car but day to day it is a little loud for my taste i couldnt use day in day out

Read full topic

item.title: Bmw x5 sav
item.dc:creator: @Maedie1 Maedie1
item.description:
@Maedie1 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Explain how a BMW is more elegant? The only thing I can come up with is the fact that they cost 3 times as much.

There’s just something about it. I can’t explain it… I’ll have to get back to you on it.

Read full topic

[quote=“sanga282, post:28, topic:279138”][quote author=Elijah link=topic=368419.msg2792366#msg2792366 date=1242857776]
I never even notice the amount of noise coming from any of my vehicles.
[/quote]
thats because you’re used to that high ambient sound level, its like certain trades that work with tools like saws,drill, airbrushes and so on that create a really high pitched noise eventually their ears just block it out and you dont actually hear it.[/quote]

I know that. But when my car is idle, it isn’t loud at all. I can hear it, but it’s a low rumble. It’s only when I punch the gas all the way to the floorboard do you hear the pistons slamming, and even then it’s not loud from in the cab. I like the sound to be honest.

When I hear the muffler on some chintzy import tuner whine, I get pissed off because it sounds awful. But when I hear a 69 Chevy Camaro SS roar down the highway I get goosebumps.

item.title: Bmw x5 sav
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Oo don’t bring up the revolution, too much to argue there

Before I said the latest Covette was actually good. It’s just a lot of American cars are using old technology still. However atm im uber stoned so i’ll discuss it tomorrow.

<3 greenie meanie chicken panini

Read full topic

item.title: Bmw x5 sav
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I’m surprised the Volvo hasn’t been mentioned yet. It’s a Hybrid of European and American styles. Using Swedish Style and American Muscle. The Volvo XC90 is very roomy, but not too large, very safe, and also powerful with its V8 3.2L-4.4L engine.

I remember distinctly someone saying Jeeps were nowhere as good as a Land Rover. Which is really inaccurate, and biased. I find that my Jeep is a very reliable, powerful, and agile vehicle. Just because you may not like something, doesn’t mean you openly condemn it.

You all(European) have said how loud American vehicles are, have you every really driven one? I never even notice the amount of noise coming from any of my vehicles. You say it squeals like a pig. But some people actually prefer to have their car be as loud as possible.

We both have very different cultures, but because they’re different doesn’t mean they’re bad. Have any of us Americans ragged on the European vehicles? No, other than how we commented on the price of them.

You all have said how loud, obnoxious, and disgusting us Americans are, yet you’re so stuck up and proud you’re not even willing to accept that maybe America isn’t all that bad. To me it sounds like you all are still butthurt about the Revolutionary War.

Read full topic

item.title: Bmw x5 sav
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:22, topic:279138”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=368419.msg2791705#msg2791705 date=1242817383]
Explain how a BMW is more elegant? The only thing I can come up with is the fact that they cost 3 times as much.
[/quote]
american cars have a stupid amount of potential power the torque on those things is fucking immense but they put it down really bad, you get noise, smoke and a fuss but overall you havnt really achieved much. Whereas the BMW is putting its power down equally and smoothly accelerating you through the mph without you realizing you are going that fast. effectively american cars are more bark than bite whereas the german equivalent are the silent type but they know their stuff[/quote]

That is true of older american muscle cars, but new ones like the SRT8 have a tuned suspension and all the fancy traction control stuff that euro cars have, even with 425/425 you can’t get it to break the tires loose unless you turn off the traction control.

Read full topic

@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

European cars woosh over the road like a breeze, American cars scream and roar like a pig. Which is why people who drive American SUV’s generally look like pigs and eat multiple burgers at the same time. BMW drivers usually go to a proper restaurant.

Anyways, why would you want an SUV as a family car?

item.title: Bmw x5 sav
item.dc:creator: @Maedie1 Maedie1
item.description:
@Maedie1 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:279138”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=368419.msg2790491#msg2790491 date=1242731208]

I’d like to see german’s keep up with this beast (6.1 Liter Hemi V8, 425 HP/425 Ft/lbs torque):

BMW X5si SAV: 3 liter, 260bhp, 225 ft-lb of torque. Relative to its size it is better then that ‘beast’.
[/quote]

Unless I wasn’t clear I don’t understand. The engine I posted goes with the Jeep Grand Cherokee above the engine pick. It looks to me like the BMW and the Jeep are about the same size, and the jeep is a full twice as powerful. Even if the jeep is bigger, it isn’t anywhere near twice as big, it would kill the BMW, not to mention that you could buy 2 or 3 of them for the same price. :)[/quote]
BMW is probably more elegant and in my opinion, overall classier. I really like BMW cars because of the fact of the elegancy. American cars are not as elegant.

Read full topic

Hummer_H1_70.jpg720×540

They can climb something like a 21" vertical wall.

Are just going to keep posting more badass offroad vehicles or what?
[/quote]

Mopar. If u check who makes the m2a2 Bradleys… Its BAE Systems… Which is a british company = Europeon

item.title: Bmw x5 sav
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:17, topic:279138”]http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/1/1d/T-80_in_Saint-Petersburg.jpg
If tanks are included, I wouldn’t mind one of those :)[/quote]

Ah a Rusian T80! You should’ve taken the T90 as an example, it’s a ‘M’ killer (hinting to the M versions of the US Army the Abram M1A and the M2A2).

As for the discusion about American/European SUV’s… I don’t like SUV’s at all. Sedan>SUV.
But I must agree with Mopar! Americans make everything big, that includes their invention of the SUV. How ever if you want style and class you will have to be at the European side (BMW). Sure American SUV’s have character, with their block like shapes and 0 to nothing streamlining. And sure they are impresive. But they don’t have the class nor style of a European SUV.

Read full topic

But I have to admit that Land Rover Defenders are awesome, theres supposedly a big lever that will get you out of trouble if you get stuck.

If your talking about normal SUVs for normal people (excluding that Hummer) American cars are the best. When you want a specialist vehicle it doesn’t matter wheres it from, as long as you get a huge lever your fine .
